conclusion: Wave 1 (left wave) originates at x = -0.2 m and propagates toward the positive x-direction with a speed v1 = 0.4 m/s.
Wave 2 (right wave) originates at x = 1.2 m and propagates toward the negative x-direction with a speed v2 = 0.4 m/s.
The two waves will meet at some point along the x-axis.

premise: The two waves will meet at some point along the x-axis.
conclusion: Let the meeting point be at x_meet. At the meeting time t_meet, the positions of the two wave fronts will coincide.

premise: Wave 1 originates at x = -0.2 m and propagates toward the positive x-direction with a speed v1 = 0.4 m/s.
conclusion: The position of the left wave front at time t is: x_left(t) = -0.2 + v1 * t

premise: Wave 2 originates at x = 1.2 m and propagates toward the negative x-direction with a speed v2 = 0.4 m/s.
conclusion: The position of the right wave front at time t is: x_right(t) = 1.2 - v2 * t

premise: At the meeting point, the positions of the two wave fronts are equal.

conclusion: Calculate the position of the meeting point x_meet: x_meet = x_left(t_meet) = -0.2 + 0.4 * 1.75 = 0.5 m
